qas.question: During what decade did rock and roll music first rise to popularity?
What does the acronym MOR stand for?
Along with pre-rock standards, what type of older songs did MOR stations play?

context: One big impetus for the development of the AC radio format was that, when rock and roll music first became popular in the mid-<a0_0>1950s<a0_0/>, many more conservative radio stations wanted to continue to play current hit songs while shying away from rock. These <a1_0>middle of the road<a1_0/> (or "MOR") stations also frequently included older, pre-rock-era adult standards and <a2_0>big band titles<a2_0/> to further appeal to adult listeners who had grown up with those songs.
